name: DICKSON, SANDRA
behaviour_type: at 18:00 resident 1-1 sitter informed writer that residnet hit her on the rt side with her phone while they were in the washroom
triggers: 1-1 sitter informed writer that she was in the washroom with resident, resident then went to bedside and picked up her phone and went back to the washroom. 1-1 sitter informed resident to wait until she is finished in the washroom then call her brother, resident got upset and hit her with the phone on her side.
interventions: writer spoke with resident re: her behaviour, an let her know that hitting staff is unacceptable. NOK, Amaechi notified
other_notes:
Behaviour - Follow up (2025-09-28 13:57): Note Text : Sandra monitored for responsive behaviour, compliantiance with care and medications. 1:1 sitter reported no behaviour.
Behaviour - Follow up (2025-09-27 22:27): Note Text : no behaviour issues this shift
Behaviour - Follow up (2025-09-27 14:47): Note Text : PSW 1:1 reported that res frustrated raised her hand attempting to hit her but did not during shower this morning, PSW said she spoke to her not to hit her, res settled and no further issue. Page 1 of 5 Note
summary: Resident 1-1 hit the sitter on the right side with her phone in the washroom at 18:00. The resident was noted to be laughing when questioned about the incident, and the nurse manager was informed.

name: PASTERNAK, ANNIE
behaviour_type: at approximately 15:20 resident was sitting in her w/c in the TV lounge when co resident(FC) was passing by . AP tried to kick co-res FC who then grabbed at AP doll that she had with her. No physical contact noted with either resident. Incident was witnessed by RAI staff who then intervened and separate each resident.
triggers: co-res FP grabbed at resident baby doll that she had with her.
interventions: resident was removed away by staff from resident FP and seated in the hallway away from each other. monitoring done
summary: At approximately 15:20, a resident attempted to kick a co-resident who then grabbed at the resident's doll in the TV lounge. No physical contact occurred, and staff intervened to separate the residents, with the resident being moved to the hallway for monitoring.
